alert.note: Alert for Clay (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 7:58AM CST until March 12 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee affecting Clay County. Noxubee River At Macon affecting Noxubee County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.5 feet, Flood water is covering the gravel road south of West Point that leads to the Tibbee Creek bridge near Tibbee. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 23.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Tibbee Creek Tibbee 23.0 21.0 Thu 6 am CST 23.0 21.1 18.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CST.
